textos_fuente.text: People - Wildflower LTD Skip to content EV Charging & Parking E-Commerce Studios Storage People Mission Press Investor Portal Menu EV Charging & Parking E-Commerce Studios Storage People Mission Press Investor Portal Adam I Gordon MANAGING PARTNER adam@wildflowerltd.com 917 837 4147 Adam I Gordon is the Managing Partner of Wildflower Ltd. A fourth-generation New Yorker, Gordon has built his career identifying and capitalizing on emerging real estate strategies. Gordon's narrative-driven approach rests on the insight that existing real estate design typologies become outmoded as consumer and commercial trends evolve. In New York City's labyrinth and dynamic environment, resolving these challenges is difficult but rewarding, and Gordon pursues every venture with curiosity, passion, and integrity. READ ADAM'S FULL BIO Michael Bowden PARTNER / DIRECTOR OF DEVELOPMENT mike@wildflowerltd.com Michael Bowden is the Director of Development at Wildflower Ltd, where he oversees innovative real estate projects that integrate technology, design, and sustainability. With over 18 years of experience in engineering and development, Michael brings a strategic approach to creating cutting-edge spaces that serve the evolving needs of businesses and communities. READ MICHAEL'S FULL BIO Wes Gordon VICE PRESIDENT / ACQUISITIONS wes@wildflowerltd.com Wes Gordon leads acquisitions at Wildflower. A lifelong New Yorker, he combines a deep passion for the city with a strong background in financial analysis and sustainability. Before joining Wildflower, Wes was an Investment Banking Associate in the Energy Transition group at Jefferies. Earlier in his career he was an Investment Banking Analyst in the Clean Energy Transition coverage group at Citi. Wes graduated from Dartmouth College with a major in Environmental Studies and was a member of the heavyweight rowing team. Kelly O'Brien HEAD OF INVESTMENTS kelly@wildflowerltd.com Kelly Oâ€™BrienÂ is the Head of Investments atÂ Wildflower LTD, where she leads capital strategy and portfolio development for one of New Yorkâ€™s most ambitious and unconventional real estate firms. With a sharp eye for opportunity and a decade of experience across real estate investment banking and investment strategy, Kelly brings institutional rigor and entrepreneurial insight to Wildflowerâ€™s mission of building at the edge of what's possible. READ KELLY'S FULL BIO info@wildflowerltd.com 80 8th Avenue, Suite 1602 New York NY 10011 Â© Copyright Wildflower 2022. All Rights Reserved Site Index Site Index

About us â€“ Wildflower Skip to content We're saying goodbye. Enjoy up to 60% Off before we close our doors. Final Days â€” Donâ€™t Miss Out! Home Women Dresses Tops & Tunics Jackets & Overlays Bottoms Kids PJ sets Stories Reverie Summer Symphony Everyday Escapades All Over The Place A Girl About Town Journal Pankhuri Mehndiratta - Tender heart & Strong will Aanchal Rai - Fashion & everything in between Daribha Lyndem - Aesthetically Pleasing Neha Paranjpe - Eclectic & Real Search INR GBP CAD USD AUD EUR JPY MYR CHF SGD 0 Home Women Dresses Tops & Tunics Jackets & Overlays Bottoms Kids PJ sets Stories Reverie Summer Symphony Everyday Escapades All Over The Place A Girl About Town Journal Pankhuri Mehndiratta - Tender heart & Strong will Aanchal Rai - Fashion & everything in between Daribha Lyndem - Aesthetically Pleasing Neha Paranjpe - Eclectic & Real Search INR GBP CAD USD AUD EUR JPY MYR CHF SGD Shopping Cart Your cart is empty Continue Shopping Origins I Initiatives I Commitments Our Story Origins & Inspiration We think of ourselves as romantics. At times we detest chaos, other times we celebrate it. But at all times we yearn for the earthy scent after the rains. Small joys of life keep us going, as much as our friends and family do. You get the picture, we are all about simplicity and fulfilment. Our creative manifestation of those sentiments birthed Wildflower. It is a culmination of nostalgia for simpler days & an intimate expression of our heritage. Rooted in comfort, Wildflower aims to bring forth the goodness of indigenousÂ heritage crafts in simple nuanced designs for everyday living. Our Brand Name As fashion andÂ business novices, when we first registered our company, we found ourselves thinking ofÂ names that would resonate with us as people and also representÂ the work we wanted to do. â€˜Wildflowerâ€™ rung true out of everything that we listed andÂ discussed. The name in itself is an embodiment of our design aesthetics â€“ an ode to the ordinary, without pretenceÂ orÂ embellishments, but breaking the monotony with colour. And above all being comfortable, rawÂ andÂ free. Approach & Studio Wildflower is an online clothing and lifestyle companyÂ based in Jaipur, Rajasthan. We create dresses andÂ separates that are thoughtfully designed for comfort andÂ value. We make our collections in small batch runs - launchingÂ at most two collections a year. All of our products are handcrafted andÂ made to order. We only work with pure andÂ handwoven fabrics that are ethically sourced from trusted vendors andÂ weavers. All of our prints are hand block printed by second generation master artisans in their workshop. The pieces are finished in our nicely lit home studio. Sustainability & Evolving Consciousness As a responsible business, we are constantly evaluating the value that we are creating for our customers, society andÂ the environment at large. We learn new things everyday, experiment with methods old and new, and toy with ideas as we map our route to sustainability in the most earnest sense. In this pursuit of doing better andÂ fulfilling our sustainability goals, we practice the following: Honour Heritage Crafts We work directly with local craftspeople based in Jaipur, Rajasthan, who translate our designs into unique prints using the age-old craft of HandÂ Block Printing . A craft that has largely become aÂ corner stone of Wildflower garments. Hand block printingÂ is an Indian art form that has been practisedÂ in Rajasthan for around 500 years. Introduced in Jaipur by the Chhipa community, the art of block printing has been passed down for generations. The processÂ starts with a design, drawn on paper, which is then meticulously carved on sheesham (Indian rosewood) wood blocks,Â with each colour in the design intricately carved ontoÂ separate blocks. Block carving is in itself an art that requiresÂ years of apprenticeship to gain precisionÂ and is done entirely by hand. This is followed by the preparation of colours by a master printer. The wooden block is then dipped in the colour and stamped onto the fabric.Â Each colour pattern is stamped individually. This elaborate process takes skill and time, as the pattern must be stamped repeatedly across the fabric, colour by colour. The final outcome with its subtle variations â€” introduced byÂ slight irregularities in print that are inevitable in handwork â€”Â gives each creation a unique and intimate character. Use Natural & Organic Fabrics We have always only worked with natural fabrics like pure cottons that are breathable andÂ soft on our skin, while also being eco-friendly. We have also recently also started working with organic handwoven Kala Cotton, sourced directly from the weavers of Kutch, Gujarat ( One Cert certified organic, Certificate No. ORG/SC/1307/001023) . Here is a little information about the socio-ecological impact of this magnificent old world cotton. Kala Cotton (pronounced kah-lah ) is mainly grown in the districts of KutchÂ (Rapar and Bhachau blocks) and Surendranagar (Patdi, Dasada and Mandal blocks) in Gujarat. It is cultivated fromÂ non-GMO (genetically modified) seeds. Organic: Having high tolerance againstÂ disease and pests, this local variety of cotton is grown without the use of any pesticides andÂ chemical fertilisers. This not only makes it economically viable for farmers, but also prevents the seepage of chemicals in the soil andÂ water bodies. Water Efficient: ItÂ is also extremely water efficient as it is purely rain-fed and isÂ drought tolerant. This makes it aÂ much better option in comparison to the conventional hybrid /Â BT cotton which takes aboutÂ 1,400 litresÂ of irrigated water to yield 1 kg of seed cotton (cotton lint with cotton seed). Low CarbonÂ Emission: Compared toÂ conventional c otton, which generates 628 grams of CO2 equivalent greenhouse gases per 1 kg seed cotton, Kala Cotton only generates 109 grams. This is due to the resilient nature of the crop that negates the use of chemical pesticides, fertilisers and excessÂ water. Focus on Natural & AZO-free Dyes We use either pigment dyes or natural dyes for our hand block printed pieces. The handwoven organic pieces are yarn dyed with AZO free, non-carcinogenic and non-toxic dyes. Our natural dyes are prepared in Bagru, near Jaipur, by usingÂ natural pigments extracted from plant-basedÂ organic sources like indigo, harda and madder. We also use pigments extracted from earth-based mineral sources. The method of preparing natural dyes is time consuming andÂ laborious, but offers a unique andÂ pleasing colour palette. Slow & Small Production We do not believe in excess production. All of our pieces are 'made to order' andÂ we only do limited pieces in each of our capsule collections. Following aÂ small-batch production process does increase our cost, but it allows us to keep our inventory low and helpsÂ prevent potential wastage. Low Carbon Footprint All of our fabrics are handcrafted in our own production studio. Most of our sourcing andÂ production happens locally in Jaipur as well, and thisÂ helps us to keep our carbon footprint to a minimum. Practicing a small-batch production process also gives us the freedom to monitorÂ our powerÂ consumption, and limit any excessive carbonÂ emissions. Fair wages We enjoy the process of creating andÂ haveÂ greatÂ respect for our artisans andÂ team members, for their persona, talentÂ andÂ workmanship. While our craftsmen like to work in their open workshops, the pieces are finished in our well lit andÂ ventilated production studio. We provide timely and fair wages to all our team members. Up cycling & zero waste In our pursuit to be a zero waste studio, we alsoÂ use the scraps to make functional pieces like masks, storage bags, buntings, toys etc. We also plan to use the tiniest of cut pieces to make handmade paper. Accessibility We believe that sustainable andÂ better options should be made available to everyone. Being a small business withÂ low overheads andÂ having no middlemen in ourÂ supply chain allows us to keep our product prices accessible while creating value for both, our customers and theÂ team. Future commitments As we move forward with a renewed purpose, weâ€™d love nothing more than to explore andÂ work with more crafts andÂ artisans from across the country. We also pledge to continue learning along the wayÂ as we re-imagine our products and processes on our journey towards being more sustainable and accessible, while creating value for everyone. If you are reading this andÂ know of any artisans that you think we should be working with in future, or any crafts and techniques you'd like to draw our attention to, then please do send us an email at aditi@wildflowerfolks.com sharing their contact details, or information on the craft. We would be ever so grateful! Community Connecting with like-minded people is a blessing, more so when there is an ease, a sense of comfort andÂ companionship. With Wildflower, we've always envisioned a platform that rises above the scope of just commerce. Instead weÂ see it asÂ a happy, intuitive space for art andÂ culture enthusiasts. In this pursuit, we'll earnestly attempt to introduce you to some incredibly interesting peeps through our journal â€“ Musings & More ; while also sharing knowledge, tips & tricks to help you in your journey of conscious living through our Sustainability Guide . Think of it all as aÂ holistic experience of sharing, learning & most of all â€“ â€˜just beingâ€™. Collaboration We staunchly believe in the power of meaningful collaborations. Not justÂ barter perhaps, but an exchange of creative ideas that leads to mutual growth andÂ impactful work. Have some ideas? Hit us up at aditi@wildflowerfolks.com We'd love to hear from you :) ABOUT About Us Contact Us COVID 19 Measures Shop CUSTOMER SERVICE Size Guide Product Care Shipping & Return Policy Terms & Conditions Privacy Policy INFORMATION For queries & information Write to us orders@wildflowerfolks.com Call or WhatsApp us +91-9599926068 Mon-Sat I 10am - 6pm (IST) Facebook Instagram YouTube Â© 2025, Wildflower

President Report | HRVic23-24 top of page Built on Open Site Navigation Close Site Navigation About HRVic Program Reports CEO Report President Report Treasurer Report Harm Reduction Victoria Annual Report 2023-2024 About HRVic Program Reports CEO Report President Report Treasurer Report Contact President Report- Robyn Dwyer " It is always challenging to choose what to highlight in this Presidentâ€™s report. This year I have selected two activities that I think are excellent reflections and demonstrations of what HRVic is fundamentally about... ..Our community! " To our valued members, our community, our stakeholders and allies, Itâ€™s been an invigorating, rewarding, incredibly busy and ultimately successful year for HRVic. â€‹ As President of the Harm Reduction Victoria (HRVic) Board, I am pleased to present our Annual Report for 2023-2024. Together with my fellow Board members, I am immensely proud of everything the organisation and its exceptional staff and volunteers have achieved this year. HRVicâ€™s strong performance is evident in the Report, where you can read about the organisationâ€™s wide and diverse range of activities and achievements. These are the realisation of the strategic work HRVic has been doing over the last few years to build capacity as a lived and living experience peer-based organisation working to improve the well-being and rights of people who consume drugs in Victoria. Our core programs â€“ PAMS, Health Promotion and Peer Networker Program, FUSE, DOPE and DanceWize â€“ continue to thrive and grow. They provide much needed harm reduction education and services and, as always, they are responsive to ever-changing community needs because they are programs and activities that are embedded in our communities, designed and delivered by lived and living experience peers. It is always challenging to choose what to highlight in this Presidentâ€™s report. This year I have selected two activities that I think are excellent reflections and demonstrations of what HRVic is fundamentally about â€“ our community! The first is the series of community dinners HRVic hosted throughout the year at our now fit-for-purpose Brunswick office. These events represent the fulfillment of HRVicâ€™s long-held desire to more actively engage with our communities. The events brought together community members â€“ long-standing and new, old and young â€“ to socialise and informally share our experiences, perspectives and needs. While providing an important space for pleasure and support, it is events such as these that simultaneously provide opportunities for us to come together to plan and strategise to help achieve our desired futures. This segues into the second activity that has occupied much of the past year â€“ the creation of HRVicâ€™s Strategic Plan for 2024â€”2027 that we will launch at this yearâ€™s Annual General Meeting. Infused throughout with our central purpose of working with and for our community, the Plan was developed collaboratively with the Board, HRVic staff, our communities and our sector partners and allies. It is the product of collective and consensus effort that provides HRVic with a strong foundation, bold vision and clear plan for the leadership and advocacy we need to support our mission to bring together our communities for our mutual rights and well-being. Of course, this Strategic Plan and all our work across this reporting year is the collective achievement of the extraordinary people who make HRVic what it is. I commend and thank all our staff and volunteers for their hard work, dedication and exemplary service. I also want to thank our valued stakeholders and partners. We could not achieve our strategic aims without your generous participation and collaboration. We look forward to continuing and further strengthening these important partnerships as we work to achieve the objectives and goals of our Strategic Plan. â€‹ We are also deeply grateful and extend our sincere thanks for the continuing respectful and highly productive relationships we enjoy with our funders in the Department of Health and the generous support they provide that enables our work addressing the multiple issues that impact on the health and well-being of people who use drugs. Finally, I also want to acknowledge and thank my fellow Board members. It is a pleasure to work alongside people with such expertise, professionalism, generosity and compassion. It is a privilege to serve as President of the Board of HRVic, to participate in the essential activities of this outstanding organisation and to support the work of our excellent CEO, Sione Crawford, and our incredible, highly skilled and committed staff and peer volunteers. I am excited to see what they achieve next.
